1120696515792723974.text:
Check out @WHOSTP Director Droegemeier’s vision for ensuring America leads the world in science and tech:
Unleash discovery and innovation
 Build our workforce of the future
 Advance American valueshttps://www.whitehouse.gov/articles/america-leading-world-science-technology/ …

1122923619678552064.text: LIVE NOW: The Future of Space broadcast with our leadership and college students from around the country! Tune in to see if your #AskNASA questions are answered. Learn about our careers & find your place in space:https://twitter.com/i/broadcasts/1OdKrvdapelKX …

1122837261362577408.text:
Today’s the day! The “Future of Space” starts at 2pm EDT, watch the LIVE stream here https://www.facebook.com/events/2182397568742389 …! 

Whether you’re watching from home, with friends or are one of the lucky students in our live audience, we want to hear from YOU! Ask your questions with #askNASA.pic.twitter.com/PoFCxwheGh

1120711602507059206.text: Starting the job on April 23, 2018, it’s been one year since @JimBridenstine was sworn in as our 13th administrator. From @Commercial_Crew flight assignments to mission moments across the solar system, here is a look at what happened in the last year: https://go.nasa.gov/2GsVDJ7 pic.twitter.com/b397BkeXiP

1122603898043236355.text: Tomorrow, Administrator @JimBridenstine will deliver the #PlanetaryDefense conference keynote at 9:20am ET. Watch for the latest on how NASA & its partners scan the skies for asteroids & comets that orbit the Sun within 30 million miles of Earth’s orbit: https://go.nasa.gov/2GEflSa pic.twitter.com/aufEug5cJB

1121170641305133057.text: Welcomed NASA Administrator @JimBridenstine to @NASA_Wallops today to celebrate a successful Antares rocket launch last week and talk about the great work ahead for the @NASA and @VCSFA_MARS teams.pic.twitter.com/CydtmYNDCr

1121805248618590209.text:
College Students! Don't forget the "Future of Space" event on Monday, April 29 at 2 p.m. EDT! Spend the weekend brainstorming questions to ask @JimBridenstine & astronauts on @Space_Station about #Moon2024. 

RSVP at https://www.facebook.com/events/2182397568742389 … and submit questions using #AskNASA.pic.twitter.com/6RRQt4UoAZ

1122264484192636935.text: Really fun #FutureCon panel discussion with Mike Gold and @CarieLemack today at #AwesomeCon. Glad to see so many young folks excited to talk about the future of space exploration! #AwesomeCon2019pic.twitter.com/fgIwp2i9Px

1122995838240923648.text: I had the honor of meeting with @TeamSpaceIL Chairman Morris Kahn today at NASA HQ. We discussed opportunities for @NASA to partner with SpaceIL on #Beresheet 2.0. If at first you don’t succeed, try again! #IsraeltotheMoonpic.twitter.com/1krOR7P93s

1120707981405040640.text: I was sworn in one year ago today & what a year it’s been! We landed @NASAInSight on Mars, flew by the most distant object ever visited by a spacecraft and accepted the challenge to land humans on the Moon by 2024.  Can’t wait to see what we will accomplish in year two!pic.twitter.com/bbRWhLrQL6

1121825552065687554.text: LIVE: @NASA Chief Scientist talks about transformative lunar sciencehttps://www.pscp.tv/w/b5M0lDFvUEVMT1dvQWRuamR8MVlxR29qelhrblFLdiT9lTuS0Z54i1ZUbqhQH6cBWeBYlmzusjAK8tVfko37 …

1121497800376823808.text: Tomorrow: @NASA Chief Scientist Jim Green will be talking to Congress about the civilization-level science opportunities on the Moon at 1pm ET. I’ll be streaming it live! Be sure and tune in here on Twitter or at: https://www.pscp.tv/JimBridenstine/follow …pic.twitter.com/kPrBLSR3lW

1123358357006561281.text: Great to see @astro_ricky today at @NASA HQ! Our @NASA_Astronauts are some of the finest men and women our country has to offer. Thank you for your service to our country!pic.twitter.com/ZsHjvmcsRb

1120768117913858049.text: Marsquake! The @NASAInSight lander has likely measured and recorded a faint seismic signal for the first time. Just as Apollo astronauts installed seismometers on the Moon, with InSight, we now have seismic data to examine from another world. https://go.nasa.gov/2VmCkdS pic.twitter.com/G2Rma8HFsq

1121155080424759296.text: Had a great visit to @NASA_Wallops with Senator @MarkWarner today. Wallops Flight Facility is critical to @NASA’s mission to pioneer the future in space exploration, scientific discovery and aeronautics research.pic.twitter.com/GsjmSA57mg

1120813234443948033.text: Enjoyed spending time with my friend @RepKinzinger today at the @RockfordAreaEDC Aerospace Symposium. @NASA’s commercial partners in Illinois are critical to our efforts to go forward to the Moon!pic.twitter.com/bw0NeBm0Q4

1122641397755072512.text: Tomorrow at 2pm ET, I'll be answering university students' questions at the Future of Space Broadcast. Joining via Space-to-Earth call will be @NASA_Astronauts on the @Space_Station! Excited to connect with the next generation of space explorers! Watch: https://www.facebook.com/events/218239756874238 …pic.twitter.com/L2VJV6Dv2s

1121932828688699392.text: We're sending the next man, and first woman, to the lunar South Pole by 2024. To do that, we're updating our call to American industry and broadening it to help us build and design an integrated human lunar lander system. https://go.nasa.gov/2OWEmf6  #Moon2024pic.twitter.com/I8EqPuFiUy
